content: Nigella Lawson writing instructions on how to click on the link in her bio on Instagram is a fascinating example of having to explain the interface and I would love to know the story behind it…

photo.alt:
The caption on a post from Nigella. She describes the photograph (meatloaf) and invites users to click on the link in her bio to get the recipe.

She then says: “Most of you know what’s meant by click on link in bio, so just skip this bit, but for those who don’t, let me explain: tap on my name right up top, which will take you to a page that has a link on it that says www.nigella.com/Instagram. When you click on this link, it will take you to a page of photographs: click on the photograph you want the recipe for and you will be taken to it!”
